title: Cars and coffee grass valley
description: Cars and coffee grass valley is a weekly car event at daily donuts in the Mcknight crossing shopping center every saturday morning from 7 to 10

title: STEAM Exploration Saturdays
Spanish story time
description: Monthly bilingual story time with Reyna Sanchez-Lopez. Enjoy lively books and activities to introduce children to the wonders of reading and books.

title: Glassblowing Taster Experience – Make a Spring Bud Vase
description: Come experience the magic of Glassblowing at The Curious Forge!, 30-minute taster sessions—Your opportunity to experience glassblowing hands-on. You will make a colorful spring bud vase (approx. 5″ to 6″ tall)., Click on date options and then time slot options to find available sessions., With the supervision and guidance of our professional glassblowers, you will discover the art of molding hot molten glass into a unique beautiful spring bud vase for yourself or to give as a memorable gift., 30-minute time slots – 1 space available per 30-minute session, Preregistration is required. Please reserve your space with a ticket below., Cost: $65 per person, Adults and Teens age 14+, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.

title: Custom Hat Making
description: Step into the timeless craft of millinery in this immersive two-day Custom Hat Making workshop. From your first block to the final stitch, you’ll transform high-quality rabbit felt into a beautifully finished, wearable hat that reflects your personal style. Whether your aesthetic is classic, bold, or whimsical, this hands-on experience invites you to slow down, work with intention, and create a piece you’ll treasure for years to come., No prior experience is needed—this beginner-friendly class is designed to guide you through the entire process in a supportive, creative environment., What You Will Learn:, Hat blocking and shaping techniques, Essential millinery tools and skills, Hand sewing and interior lining, Hat trimming and decorative finishes, Fabric manipulation and design customization, Materials & Supplies:, All materials are provided, including rabbit felt and lining, Participants are encouraged to bring any special fabrics, trims, ribbons, or beads they might want to incorporate into their hat design, Class Details:, Dates: Friday & Saturday, 2/28 and 3/1, Time: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM each day, Breaktime: 2:00 – 3:00 PM daily., Please bring a bag lunch, snack, and beverage (there are no food services near The Forge) , Skill Level: Beginner / No experience required, Ages: 16 and up, Price: $336 + $100 materials fee, Minimum 5 participants/Maximum 10 participants., Come enjoy a relaxed, creative environment while learning a traditional craft and leaving with a stunning, handmade hat that’s uniquely yours.

title: Custom Hat Making
description: Step into the timeless craft of millinery in this immersive two-day Custom Hat Making workshop. From your first block to the final stitch, you’ll transform high-quality rabbit felt into a beautifully finished, wearable hat that reflects your personal style. Whether your aesthetic is classic, bold, or whimsical, this hands-on experience invites you to slow down, work with intention, and create a piece you’ll treasure for years to come., No prior experience is needed—this beginner-friendly class is designed to guide you through the entire process in a supportive, creative environment., What You Will Learn:, Hat blocking and shaping techniques, Essential millinery tools and skills, Hand sewing and interior lining, Hat trimming and decorative finishes, Fabric manipulation and design customization, Materials & Supplies:, All materials are provided, including rabbit felt and lining, Participants are encouraged to bring any special fabrics, trims, ribbons, or beads they might want to incorporate into their hat design, Class Details:, Dates: Saturday & Sunda, 2/28 and 3/1, Time: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM each day, Breaktime: 2:00 – 3:00 PM daily., Please bring a bag lunch, snack, and beverage (there are no food services near The Forge) , Skill Level: Beginner / No experience required, Ages: 16 and up, Price: $336 + $100 materials fee, Minimum 5 participants/Maximum 10 participants., Come enjoy a relaxed, creative environment while learning a traditional craft and leaving with a stunning, handmade hat that’s uniquely yours.

title: Seniors Pancake Breakfast
description: Join us in the community room at the Truckee Donner Senior Apartments for pancakes, eggs and bacon or sausage. Breakfast is prepared each month by one of the Community Non-Profit service organizations.

title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
description: Discover the art of woodturning and learn to make a beautiful wood bowl using a wood lathe – no experience is required!, Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
venue_name: Commercial Street in Nevada City and at the Miners Foundry.
description: The community parade begins at 12:00 noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial Street (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dancing outdoor performance on Spring Street, more entertainment, exhibits, and fun will take place inside the Miners Foundry beginning at 1:00 p.m. Free admission. We thank the Miners Foundry, the Nevada City Chamber of Commerce, the City of Nevada City, and the Nevada City Arts Council for their collaboration., Our parade Grand Marshals are Susan Levitz and Pascale Fusshoeller, founders of YubaNet.com, who have been staunch supporters of CATS and a great asset and news source to the community. , Parade units include the audience favorite -- Chinese ceremonial Lion Dancers and a 72’ Chinese Dragon from Eastern Ways Martial Arts of Sacramento -- second and third graders from Bell Hill Academy, “Mulan,” (aka Lily Emmolo), members of Grass Valley Aikikai martial arts, theatre groups, and other community entries. Food vendors at the Miners Foundry are Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen and Gold Rush Cookies. There will be Asian-themed arts and crafts and gifts for sale, a kid’s table, mahjong, a new children’s Chinese New Year book launch and sale by Allison Chan, face painting with Chinese horoscope tattoos, Chinese tea ceremony demonstrations, Rose Murphy from the Nevada County Historical Society promoting free self-guided historic walking tours of the Grass Valley and Nevada City Chinatowns, Lisa Redfern and Rose Murphy showing their film, "Chinese Family Stories - From Exclusion to Pillars of the Community," community vendors and more. We are seeking parade entries, entertainers, vendors, exhibitors, sponsors, and lots of volunteers. Contact Jeannie Wood at info@catsweb.org

title: Ceramics 101 – Mud Therapy
description: Join us at The Curious Forge for Sunday Ceramics with Bob Davis!, 3-class sessions , Discover the joy of working with clay in this immersive 3 class session workshop at The Curious Forge! Whether you’re brand new to ceramics or looking to expand your skills, this class with instructor Bob Davis is designed to give you a well-rounded understanding of this dynamic medium., You’ll explore a variety of techniques, including:, Potter’s Wheel – Learn the fundamentals of throwing and shaping clay., Hand-Building – Create unique forms using slabs, coils, and extruders., Surface Design & Embellishment – Experiment with textures, patterns, and finishing techniques., Throughout the course, you’ll craft a variety of functional and decorative pieces—choose from sushi plates, tapas servers, cups, spoon rests, succulent planters, and more! By the end of the series, you’ll gain confidence in your skills and discover which techniques inspire you most., No experience? No problem! This class is open to all levels, from total beginners to those looking to refine their craft., Ages: 15 – Adult, Price: $162 + $30 materials, Total Class Time: Three 3-hour Classes = 9 hours, Note: Your Glazed pieces will be ready for pick up 7-10 days after they have been fired, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Join us for a hands-on creative journey and take home your own handmade ceramics!, All supplies provided, Class 4 minimum/8 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

title: Ray Ushikubo: Piano and Violin Virtuoso
description: Ray showcases his stunning and award winning musicianship on both piano and violin. Ray will play the MIM Steinway Grand as well as one of the rarest and most famous violins in the world, the 1741 "Playfair" Guarneri del Gesù violin. At the age of only 24, he has already performed as a soloist with major orchestras across the United States, including as a pianist with the Los Angeles Philharmonic, as a violin soloist with the Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra, and on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno!

title: Three Times Through at the Grass Valley Brewing Co.
description: Three Times Through live at the Grass Valley Brewing Co. for Celtic Sunday. 1st Sunday of every month. People ask us, “What is that instrument? And did you just mash-up a Rolling Stones song with an Irish jig?” Playing unique instruments, we are a kinda Celtic quartet re-imagining and blending traditional tunes with modern music. Come curious, leave refreshed!

title: North by Northwest (1959)
description: NORTH BY NORTHWEST finds New York City ad executive Roger O. Thornhill (Cary Grant) pursued by ruthless spy Phillip Vandamm (James Mason) after Thornhill is mistaken for a government agent. Hunted relentlessly by Vandamm's associates, the harried Thornhill ends up on a cross-country journey, meeting the beautiful and mysterious Eve Kendall (Eva Marie Saint) along the way. Soon Vandamm's henchmen close in on Thornhill, resulting in some of the most iconic action sequences of all time.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Nevada City Odd Fellows Open Mic
description: The most relaxed, most welcoming open mic in Western Nevada County

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Tuesday Morning Ceramics – Hand-Building Techniques
description: Tuesday Morning Ceramics and Pottery Class with Pamela Montalbano, 6 class series, Tuesday Mornings 10:30 am – 12:30 pm, Price: $245 Public ($195 for 6 classes + $50 materials), Discover your creativity, engage your mind, and come play with clay! In this Ceramics and Pottery Class, we will use hand-building techniques to make functional and non-functional ceramics and pottery projects using slabs and coils. Clay, Glazing, and firings are included in the materials fee. Participants can sign up for additional Tuesday Morning classes each month if they wish to continue their ceramics adventure., We will be hand-building and then every third class will be a glazing class. At least 2 projects will be made in this series., Class 5 minimum/8 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet the minimum, the class will be rescheduled)

title: African Drum and Dance of Nevada County
description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience

title: Glassblowing Taster Experience – Make a Spring Bud Vase
description: Come experience the magic of Glassblowing at The Curious Forge!, 30-minute taster sessions—Your opportunity to experience glassblowing hands-on. You will make a colorful spring bud vase (approx. 5″ to 6″ tall)., Click on date options and then time slot options to find available sessions., With the supervision and guidance of our professional glassblowers, you will discover the art of molding hot molten glass into a unique beautiful spring bud vase for yourself or to give as a memorable gift., 30-minute time slots – 1 space available per 30-minute session, Preregistration is required. Please reserve your space with a ticket below., Cost: $65 per person, Adults and Teens age 14+, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.

title: The Rocket Man
description: Presented by The Center for the Arts , Tuesday, March 3, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating , , Genre: Tribute, Attention Elton John fans! Moon Coin Productions (Producers of ABBA Tribute “ABRA Cadabra” and Eagles Tribute “Take It To The Limit”) Presents The Rocket Man – A Tribute to Elton John from Vancouver performing in Grass Valley for the 1st time on March 3, 2026., Don't miss this usually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished Vocalist, Pianist and Star Performer Sean Trombley who gives a genuine & powerful Tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musician. Sean’s stunning vocals capture the essence of Elton John at the height of his vocal power and range in the 1970’s and he brings these beautiful songs to life in a way that touches the soul and uplifts the heart. Backed by a spectacular live band, multi-media, dazzling costumes and captivating dancers, this high-energy cast of performers will transport you back in time and have you moving, smiling and singing along to all of Elton John’s most iconic hits including Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Benny & The Jets, Tiny Dancer, Your Song, Saturday Night’s Alright, Philadelphia Freedom, Good-bye Yellow brick Road, Daniel, Candle In The Wind and countless others! A must see show if you love the music of Elton John!

title: Rodney Crowell at The Center For The Arts - Grass Valley
venue_name: The Center For The Arts - Grass Valley Grass Valley California
description: Welcome to The Center For The Arts - Grass Valley, your go-to spot for unforgettable live performances in the heart of Grass Valley, California! On March 4, 2026, we are thrilled to present the legendary Rodney Crowell at 7:00 PM. Known for his soulful lyrics and captivating stage presence, Rodney Crowell promises a night of music that will touch your heart and leave you wanting more., The Center For The Arts - Grass Valley provides an intimate and cozy atmosphere, perfect for experiencing live music up close and personal. Located in the bustling city of Grass Valley, our venue is easily accessible and surrounded by a vibrant arts scene, making it the ideal spot for a night of entertainment., Don't miss this rare opportunity to see Rodney Crowell live at The Center For The Arts - Grass Valley! Gather your friends and family, grab your tickets, and get ready for a night you won't soon forget. Join us for an evening of music, laughter, and memories that will last a lifetime. Book your tickets now and secure your spot for a show you won't want to miss!

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Opera 101: Musings with the Maestro
description: This conversation with Ryan Murray invites ​you to ​reconsider how you think about opera, whether you are a devoted fan, have never experienced it, or are… opera-curious. In this lively, interactive Zoom presentation, the Maestro​ (MIM Artistic Director Ryan Murray) pulls back the curtain on one of the most dynamic and emotionally powerful art forms ever created. Tracing opera’s evolution from the 1600s to today, participants will explore how opera has continually reinvented itself across centuries, styles, and cultures., Far from being elitist, opera was originally the people’s art—an immersive blend of orchestra, voice, drama, design, and storytelling. Through highlights of essential works, engaging commentary, and audience Q&A, attendees will gain practical tools to explore opera on their own and discover what resonates with them. No prior musical experience is required—just curiosity. Whether you’re brand new to opera or simply want a fresh perspective, this welcoming, plain language session offers an ideal access point into a vast and thrilling corner of the classical repertoire., Ryan Murray is the Artistic Director of Music in the Mountains, Music Director of the Auburn Symphony, Principal Pops Conductor of the Modesto Symphony and he is the Director of Orchestra and Opera at California State University Sacramento, and conducts the Sacramento Youth Symphony. An award-winning opera conductor, Ryan is the past Music Director of Opera Modesto and Fresno Grand Opera., , Ryan was the winner of the Vienna Philharmonic’s prestigious Ansbacher Fellowship for Young Conductors and was awarded second place in the 2019 American Prize for Orchestral Conducting; he garnered national recognition for his performances of contemporary opera as the winner of the 2017 American Prize in Opera.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Oil & Acrylic Painting: A Guided Exploration with Chappy
description: Oil & Acrylic Adventures: Your Subject, Your Style. In-depth personalized painting instruction on the subject matter of your choice., Class Details:, Schedule: Four 3-hour sessions (12 hours total), Cost: $198 for the public, Level: Suitable for beginners and experienced painters, Class Overview, Explore the art of painting in this fun and immersive four-session workshop! Using a simple and effective four-step approach, you’ll learn how to bring any subject to life—whether it’s a portrait, a wildflower-filled landscape, or a captivating still life. Over four weeks, you’ll gain a broader understanding of composition, color, value, and texture, ending the series with a completed painting you’re proud of. Guided by Chappy, you’ll receive personalized instruction tailored to your creative vision., What You’ll Learn:, A straightforward four-step painting process, Principles of composition, color, value, and texture, How to translate your chosen subject into a successful painting, What to Bring:, Any opaque medium and matching brushes (Don’t buy any new paints until after you attend the first class and Chappy will review supplies with you), Two painting surfaces (canvas, paper, board, etc.), Several photos of your subject (5×7 or larger hard copy recommended or an iPad), A painting smock or old clothes, If you do not have any painting supplies yet, please contact spark@thecuriousforge.org for a list of supplies needed to start., Additional Information:, Class Size: Minimum 4, Maximum 6 participants, Registration: Pre-registration required, Cancellation Policy: 7-day advance notification required (read the full policy here), Get ready to unleash your creativity and paint whatever the heck you want!

title: Youth Maker XD Woodshop I – Afterschool Workshop
description: Youth Maker XD Woodshop I, This class is perfect for kids who love to create and build! They will learn the basics of woodworking through fun, hands-on projects using a variety of tools. They will work on unique projects that they can take home and show off to their friends and family., Our classes are designed to be both fun and educational, with experienced instructors who are passionate about sharing their skills and knowledge with young people. We take great care to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where every child can feel valued and supported., Ages 8 – 11, 4-class series one day a week – 4:00 -5:30 pm each afternoon, $150 ($125 + $25 materials), Class 4 minimum/6 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

title: Glassblowing Level 2 – Make a Drinking Glass
description: Glassblowing Level 2 – Make a Drinking Glass , Prerequisite: for those who have completed Glassblowing Beginning Paperweight Class, Continue your Glassblowing adventures in this 4-hour workshop. Blowing a cup will be the main focus of this class. Students will each practice making blown glass with magnificent colored accents of their own design. You will also learn basic teamwork skills necessary to move forward to the next level glassblowing classes., Completing this class will fill the prerequisite for our next level class, Level 3 Glassblowing Drinking Glass, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 16+ and Adults, Price: $240, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Intro to Stained Glass – Level 1
description: Intro to Stained Glass. Level 1 – Straight Cuts, Experience the art of stained glass in this beginner-friendly workshop! Join us to craft a small suncatcher using vibrant glass pieces in this class with Charne Morris. No experience necessary—just bring your enthusiasm!, This introductory class focuses on straight cuts and will teach you the basics of stained glass safety., Throughout this 3-hour class, you will learn pattern transfer, glass cutting, grinding, foiling, soldering, and polishing. You will go home with a finished project piece that is roughly 3.5” x 4”., A materials cost of $20 is required on the day. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., What You’ll Learn:, Basics of stained glass art, How glass behaves and the creation process, Selecting and cutting glass pieces, Creating a stained glass suncatcher using the copper foil method and soldering techniques, Details:, Duration: 3 hours, Price: $79 class fee + plus additional material fee $20 is required during class. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., Ages: Adults and 16+, Participants: Minimum of 3, maximum of 6 (Class will be rescheduled if minimum attendance is not met) Please note: All classes require a minimum number of participants and may be rescheduled if that minimum is not met. If this happens, we’ll let you know in advance and work with you to get you into the next available class., Join us for this creative journey and leave with your own stunning stained glass suncatcher!

title: First Thursday with Musical Guest Bart Budwig
description: Meet up with friends for this long-standing monthly tradition of live music, beer, and plenty of fun. Live music hosted by Spike McGuire and presented in partnership with Loud as Folk, a regional singer-songwriter showcase.

title: Motion Theater
description: With Minica Farbiarz and Evan Specter. We have decades of exploration as performers, teachers of autobiographical, physical, embodied storytelling.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Opening Talk with Artist and Writer Jonathon Keats
description: Traverse the expanse of time and consider the environmental complexities that led to the concept and creation of Centuries of the Bristlecone with Jonathon Keats, artist, writer, and experimental philosopher. Keats’ conceptually driven transdisciplinary projects explore all aspects of society, adapting methods from the sciences and the humanities. Following the talk, enjoy a ceremonial etching on the clock., , Centuries of the Bristlecone is now on-view and was created in collaboration with Phil Abernethy, Brittany Cox, Jason Iceman, and The Long Now Foundation., , This public talk is a complementary program to the 2026 NV STEAM Conference.

title: Advanced Glassblowing Level 4 – Discovering New Techniques
description: Glassblowing Level 4– Advanced Glassblowing Techniques, Prerequisite: for those who have completed our level 3 Class at The Forge or at least 11 hours of glassblowing class instruction at The Forge., Continue your Glassblowing adventures in this 4-hour workshop. Work with Robert and learn advanced glassblowing techniques. You will also learn basic teamwork skills necessary to move forward to the next level of glassblowing classes., Learn how to use frit and powders to achieve patterns other then the spotted look we are familiar with. Create the look of feathers, scales, stone, cracked earth and other effects. Your instructor will spend the first hour and a half demonstrating them and students will be let loose to try some for themselves., Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.Ages 16+ and Adults, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Kids Night Out
description: Northwoods Clubhouse, Tahoe Donner

First Fridays
description: www.historictruckee.com

title: Cars and coffee grass valley
description: Cars and coffee grass valley is a weekly car event at daily donuts in the Mcknight crossing shopping center every saturday morning from 7 to 10

title: Sierra Word Fest (formerly Sierra Writer's Conference)
description: 2026 Sierra WordFest: Power of Place, Now in its second decade, the Sierra Writers Conference is evolving into the Sierra WordFest because it isn’t just for writers. It’s a celebration for those who love the spoken and written word. This year’s event will feature well-known writers, such as Daniel Handler (aka Lemony Snicket), and center on the theme “Power of Place.” The 2026 Sierra WordFest welcomes all literarians – listeners, readers and writers alike., Seize this moment in this place. Join us for three days of presentations and workshops that feed your soul, inspire your craft, and connect you with your community.

title: STEAM Exploration Saturdays
St. Piran's Day Celebration
description: St. Piran's Day Pasty Toss is a fun, family-friendly tradition we have here in Grass Valley honoring our Cornish connection. Join us in downtown Grass Valley on the Mill Street Plaza and watch as Grass Valley's civil servants challenge Nevada City's for a friendly Pasty Tossing competition and so much more!, Dogs are Welcome at the St. Piran's Day Celebration! Pasties made for tossing are prepared with pet-friendly ingredients, so bring your dog and let them join in the fun!

title: ST PIRAN'S DAY Celebration in Downtown Grass Valley! Join us as Grass Valley honors its rich Cornish heritage with a lively Saint Piran’s Day celebration.
description: 🎉 Celebrate Saint Piran’s Day in Grass Valley! 🎉, Join us as Grass Valley honors its rich Cornish heritage with a lively Saint Piran’s Day celebration. From flag-raising and Cornish songs to the legendary Pasty Toss, this family-friendly event pays tribute to the Cornish miners who helped shape our town. Come enjoy tradition, community, and a taste of history—because on Saint Piran’s Day, everyone’s Cornish! 🖤🤍🥟

You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. title: Kid’s Creation Day! Silly Sculptures & Fun Figures in Polymer Clay
description: Kids’ Creation Day! Fun with Polymer Clay, Join us for a colorful, hands-on adventure in sculpting, shaping, and imagining! Polymer clay is the perfect, no-mess medium for kids of all ages to explore their creativity. In this fun and flexible workshop, young makers will experiment with different texturing tools, colors, and techniques to bring their ideas to life — from silly creatures and tiny treasures to action figurines and imaginative keepsakes., We’ll bake each creation during class so everyone goes home with a finished, cured piece they can proudly display. If time allows, we’ll even add a splash of color with paints for extra flair!, Our youth workshops are designed to be both playful and educational, guided by experienced instructors who love helping kids discover the joy of making. Every class is a new opportunity for your child to explore, experiment, and create something totally unique., Ages: 6-16 (no experience needed), Schedule: Offered once a month — 1-day workshop (1–2 hours), Cost: $30 + $15 materials fee, Class Size: Minimum 3 / Maximum 8 participants, Let your child’s imagination run wild — the sky’s the limit!

title: Flameworking Implosion Marbles
description: Flameworking Implosion Marbles –, Prerequisite: prior flameworking class or experience, Discover the magic hidden inside molten glass., In this flameworking series, participants will dive into the mesmerizing world of implosion marbles—where heat, gravity, and precision come together to create intricate 3D designs suspended inside solid glass. Working on the torch, you’ll learn how to carefully control molten glass as surface designs are drawn inward, forming layered, dimensional patterns within a perfectly shaped marble., Across three hands-on sessions, you’ll explore multiple implosion styles while refining your heat control, shaping skills, and surface decoration techniques. This class is both technical and awe-inspiring, offering plenty of “how did that just happen?” moments as glass seemingly moves on its own., What You’ll Create, Solid glass marbles, Frit implosion marbles, Firework implosion marbles, Flower implosion marbles, What You’ll Learn, Advanced heat control on the torch, Imploding solid glass to create 3D internal designs, Shaping and finishing marbles, Drawing and layering color on the glass surface, How to harness the magic of glass movement, Class Details, Skill Level: prior flameworking class or experience required, Format: 3-session series | 3 hours per session, Dates: Saturdays — 3/7, 3/14, and 3/21, Time: 1:00–4:00 PM, Ages: Adults & Teens 12+, Class Size: Maximum of 6 participants, Price: $225 + $60 materials fee, Additional Notes, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Whether you’re fascinated by technical glasswork or drawn to the visual drama of implosions, this class offers a deep dive into one of flameworking’s most captivating techniques—leaving you with beautiful, mind-bending marbles and sharpened torch skills to match.

title: Glassblowing Taster Experience – Make a Spring Bud Vase
description: Come experience the magic of Glassblowing at The Curious Forge!, 30-minute taster sessions—Your opportunity to experience glassblowing hands-on. You will make a colorful spring bud vase (approx. 5″ to 6″ tall)., Click on date options and then time slot options to find available sessions., With the supervision and guidance of our professional glassblowers, you will discover the art of molding hot molten glass into a unique beautiful spring bud vase for yourself or to give as a memorable gift., 30-minute time slots – 1 space available per 30-minute session, Preregistration is required. Please reserve your space with a ticket below., Cost: $65 per person, Adults and Teens age 14+, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.

title: Glassblowing Taster Experience – Make a Spring Bud Vase
description: Come experience the magic of Glassblowing at The Curious Forge!, 30-minute taster sessions—Your opportunity to experience glassblowing hands-on. You will make a colorful spring bud vase (approx. 5″ to 6″ tall)., Click on date options and then time slot options to find available sessions., With the supervision and guidance of our professional glassblowers, you will discover the art of molding hot molten glass into a unique beautiful spring bud vase for yourself or to give as a memorable gift., 30-minute time slots – 1 space available per 30-minute session, Preregistration is required. Please reserve your space with a ticket below., Cost: $65 per person, Adults and Teens age 14+, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.

title: Word Jam
description: Join the Word Jam that takes place at 7pm on the second and fourth Sundays. Participants get 5 minutes to read a piece they have written

title: Grand Illusion (La grande illusion)
description: In 1917, in a German camp, a group of French prisoners - including Captain de Boëldieu (Pierre Fresnay) and Lieutenants Maréchal (Jean Gabin) and Rosenthal (Marcel Dalio) - prepare to escape. At the last moment, they are moved to a fortress commanded by German aristocrat von Rauffenstein (Eric von Stroheim), who becomes friendly with Boëldieu. One of the very first prison escape movies, GRAND ILLUSION is considered Jean Renoir’s antiwar masterpiece, and one of the greatest films ever made. IN FRENCH W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Nevada City Odd Fellows Open Mic
description: The most relaxed, most welcoming open mic in Western Nevada County

title: Good Morning Truckee
description: NEW!! ONLINE PRE-REGISTRATION at TruckeeChamber.com. Bring your receipt with you and breeze through the Express Check-In Line to get your breakfast and seat faster!, Hear from Jameson Stafford of Elevate Blue, Andy Scott of 1Bios and Johannes Ziegler of Tahoe Silicon Mountain on Truckee's Start-Up Scene and Tech Community.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: African Drum and Dance of Nevada County
description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience

title: Glassblowing Level 3 – Expand Drinking Glass Skills
description: Glassblowing Level 3 – Drinking Glass – Expand your Glassblowing Skills, Prerequisite: for those who have completed Glassblowing a Drinking Glass Level 2, Continue your Glassblowing adventures in this 4-hour workshop. Expand on your Glassworking techniques and create unique drinking cups. In this 2nd level class, you will work on perfecting your glass making skills. Students will each practice making blown glass with magnificent colored accents of their own design. You will also learn basic teamwork skills necessary to move forward to the next level of glassblowing classes., Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 16+ and Adults, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Playwriting Group
description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: RiversLab 2: Island of a Stream
description: Join Jack Roney, SYRCL’s Americorps Restoration Coordinator, to discuss Hugeny et. al (2011) and its implications for Freshwater Conservation. Learn how the study of islands informs our understanding of isolated ecosystems everywhere, and how to harness this information to protect rare species and fragmented habitats. Highlights include: Rock-climbing fish, the native trout of Mexico, and Caribbean tidepools, RiversLab will be held at the SYRCL Office on Railroad Ave in Nevada City — a virtual option is also available., Contact Jack Roney at jack@yubariver.org for more information.

title: Karaoke - Grass Valley Brewing Co.
description: It’s Karaoke Night at GVBC with DJ Kenn!

title: Motion Theater
description: With Minica Farbiarz and Evan Specter. We have decades of exploration as performers, teachers of autobiographical, physical, embodied storytelling.

title: Tangled Roots Open Mic Slam
description: Open Mic hosted by Nevada County Poet Laureate Karen Terrey, open mic readers compete for a chance to read their work from the Main Stage at the 10th annual Sierra Poetry Festival on Saturday, April 18. Two winners will be selected by a panel of judges.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Branches of Life: Forest Resilience and Collaboration on the Truckee River
description: When we protect our forests, we protect life. Healthy, resilient forests along the Truckee River reduce wildfire risk, safeguard water quality, and preserve the beauty and biodiversity that define Northern Nevada. , Learn how the Nevada Chapter of The Nature Conservancy is working to improve forest health – before catastrophic wildfires occur – by restoring the natural role of fire, strengthening forest ecosystems, enhancing community safety, and honoring Indigenous knowledge. , This is part of an Art Bite series featuring local conservation and sustainability organizations, which complements Into the Time Horizon.

title: Poetry Open Mic
description: Bring your favorite poem to share. Maybe you wrote it, maybe someone else did, but it resonated with you. Maybe you found it at just the right time ~ so feel free to share that story in a safe and welcoming place., Suggested donation $10 each meeting. No one turned away ~ Wheelchair access available., ***Please park in the rear of the Veteran's Memorial parking lot, 255 S. Auburn St, and use the path to the center.
